Name: glioblastoma classical subtype
Definition: A glioblastoma multiforme that is characterized by abnormally high levels of epidermal growth factor receptor and the absence of p53 mutations.

Name: glioblastoma proneural subtype
Definition: A glioblastoma multiforme that is characterized by IDH1 and p53 mutations and Platelet Derived Growth Factor A amplification.

Name: glioblastoma mesenchymal subtype
Definition: A glioblastoma multiforme that is characterized by the most frequent number of mutation of the Neurofibromin 1 gene.

Name: glioblastoma neural subtype
Definition: A glioblastoma multiforme that is characterized by the expression of several gene types that are also typical of the brain's normal

Name: gliosarcoma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in glial cells and is located in brain or located in spine.

Name: obsolete secondary glioblastoma multiforme
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in glial cells and is located in brain or located in spine.
